text: Bell Labs held a press conference announcing the invention of the junction transistor. Dr. William Shockley was featured at the conference.
The five-year-old MIT computer Whirlwind added the ability to input data directly with a keyboard. Programmers began to enjoy independence from punch cards.
Sabeer Bhatia and Jack Smith launched a free web email service called HoTMaiL, a play on HTML. Microsoft bought it a year later, and called it Hotmail for years, but it's now Outlook.com.
